title: Lubbock psychologist urges gun safety after tragic shooting death
content:
LUBBOCK, TX (KCBD) -
Lubbock police tell us the father was cleaning or working on his gun when it fired, accidentally shooting and killing a 5-year-old boy on Tuesday night.
The bullet struck the boy who was sitting in the next room.
Authorities responded to the call on 71st and Canton Avenue, near Trinity Christian High School around 6 p.m. Tuesday night.
The family describes the boy as a hyperactive, fun-loving kid.
LPD tells us no arrests have been made as of Wednesday, but the investigation continues.
Lubbock Board of Health member and local psychologist, Dr. Brian Carr, says education on gun safety is key.
He says just having a conversation with your kids about guns and firearms can really go a long way.
"Guns are a part of America and they're going to be here," he says. "I think we have a duty to do what we can to manage those and to recognize they have lethal force."
Doctor Carr says the most important step to take in gun safety is keeping firearms in a locked box and making sure they are unloaded.
Dr. Carr is making a presentation on gun violence at City Hall to the Board of Health at 12:30 p.m. on Friday.
This week, Doctor Carr is making a presentation on gun violence at City Hall to the Board of Health.
"We just want every citizen that's going to own guns to be responsible in how they're maintained and how they're stored," he says.
